description: From Middle English etik, from Late Latin ēthicus, from Ancient Greek ἠθῐκός (ēthikós).

adjectives.description: ethic (comparative more ethic, superlative most ethic)

description: From Middle English etik, ethik, from Old French ethique, from Late Latin ēthica, from Ancient Greek ἠθική (ēthikḗ), from ἠθικός (ēthikós, “of or for morals, moral, expressing character”), from ἦθος (êthos, “character, moral nature”).

entries.meaning: A set of principles of right and wrong behaviour guiding, or representative of, a specific culture, society, group, or individual.
examples: I think the golden rule is a great ethic.
